resource-env-ref.description: Data Services JMS queue for incoming SOAP requests sent by other applications. Attention: if the main configuration does not activate JMS through the property 'ebx.jms.activate', then this environment entry will be ignored by EBX® runtime.

Data Services JMS queue for failures. It contains incoming SOAP requests for which an error has occurred. This allows replaying these messages if necessary. Attention: to be used at runtime, the main configuration shall activate JMS through the property 'ebx.jms.activate', and also the queue for failures through the property 'ebx.jms.activate.queueFailure'.

D3 Master Communication JMS queue (only for D3 mode 'slave' or 'hub'). It specifies the name of the communication queue to send SOAP message to the Master D3 node. Attention: if the main configuration does not activate JMS and D3 (slave, hub or master node) through the property 'ebx.d3.mode', 'ebx.jms.activate' and 'ebx.jms.d3.activate' then this environment entry will be ignored by EBX® runtime.

D3 Reply JMS queue (for all D3 mode except 'single' mode). It specifies the name of the reply queue for D3 node conversation. Attention: if the main configuration does not activate JMS and D3 (slave, hub or master node) through the property 'ebx.d3.mode', 'ebx.jms.activate' and 'ebx.jms.d3.activate' then this environment entry will be ignored by EBX® runtime.

D3 Archive JMS queue (for all D3 mode except 'single' mode). It specifies the name of transfer archive queue to receive archives. Attention: if the main configuration does not activate JMS and D3 (slave, hub or master node) through the property 'ebx.d3.mode', 'ebx.jms.activate' and 'ebx.jms.d3.activate' then this environment entry will be ignored by EBX® runtime.

D3 Communication JMS queue (for all D3 mode except 'single' mode). It specifies the name of the communication queue to receive SOAP messages. Attention: if the main configuration does not activate JMS and D3 (slave, hub or master node) through the property 'ebx.d3.mode', 'ebx.jms.activate' and 'ebx.jms.d3.activate' then this environment entry will be ignored by EBX® runtime.

resource-ref.description: JDBC data source for EBX® Repository. Attention: if the main configuration specifies the property 'ebx.persistence.url', then this environment entry will be ignored by EBX® runtime.

Java Mail session used to send e-mails from EBX®. Attention: if the main configuration does not set 'ebx.mail.activate' to 'true', or if it specifies the property 'ebx.mail.smtp.host', then this environment entry will be ignored by EBX® runtime.

JMS connection factory used by EBX® to create connections with the JMS provider configured in the operational environment of the application server. Attention: if the main configuration does not activate JMS through the property 'ebx.jms.activate', then this environment entry will be ignored by EBX® runtime.
